lines.text: Have you got the answer to Hydronaut's question?
I'm just sending it out now.
rook takes queen, check.
because they're hungry. People kill each other for nothing.
Anything the matter?
What? Oh, no. I... could've sworn I'd seen those legs somewhere before.
Our mission is to plant warning sensors...
I know that. We take care of *my* mission when we've completed yours.
Well, I can't commit the rest of the crew!
Well don't worry, I'll, I'll - how you say? - cut them in.
Well what makes you think they'll go along with you?
Well haven't you heard? It's better to be a rich scientist than a poor one.
Well, we're all loaded. Where's the dame?
She's late.
Excuse me, I have to get my hat box.
Hat box?
Hat box?
Hat box.
You'll love it. It's absolutely adorable.
[opens the hat box to show it contains two guinea pigs]
Itty and Bitty.
Itty and... Bitty?
For oxygen analysis.
Oh.
*Now*... if I could find me a mermaid built just like *that*...!
[Volker ascends the ladder to meet Maggie]
For once that guy and I agree on what would make a really tasty dish.
*Well*...! Looks like something topless is going on topside.
[Mosby slams down a scuba tank in anger]
Hey, hey, hey! Take it easy! You'll blow a gasket!
Uh, what's the matter with *her*?
Eh, well we got a phone message for you from Dr. Boren. Your first choice for a medic is unavailable, and there's no time to shop around.
You mean they're getting new tremors.
Oh yeah, big ones.
Oh, boy.
Uh, Boren says you've *got* to take Maggie, even if you *don't* want her, and um, unfortunately, that was the part of the conversation she overheard.
Stahl? He lives at the bottom of the Caribbean bay like a hermit crab, studying underwater survival. You'll never get *him*.
I couldn't care less. I got it made down here. I got my research, my books, my music. Why should I leave all this for a bunch of idiots who're going to blow themselves up?
That's not an ocean out there! That's a veritable minestrone!
What?
You've never seen such food! Enough to feed a *billion* fish! Look at that!
What is it?
It's food! It's food!
What's with *him*?
Uh, he found some minestrone.
Looks like Hell itself.
Be quiet! They're not rats, they're guinea pigs. Hold these.
[hands guinea pigs to Dr. Mosby]
You Americans. Always in such a hurry.

Uh, Mr. Vice President... If we plant these sensors, around the world under the sea, in pressure points along here, and through here, and *anchor* them in the crust of the earth, we'll have the early warning system we need.
Well this means a great deal of risk, doesn't it?
We know less about the deep oceans than we do the surface of the moon.
And you're willing to take on this risk?
Well, that's why we're here.
Well gentleman, I'd like you to proceed on the assumption that I can get the necessary appropriation for the voyage of the Hydronaut.
Great!
What the hell's going on around here?
Swing him over. Set him right on the deck. Easy, now.
Well who's the idiot in this diving suit?

[emerging from the diving suit]
Dr. Mosby, I presume.
Margaret Hanford is as handy with a skillet as a scalpel.
We're the whole crew?
Well the Gemini capsule only had two.
Man your stations.
I thought we were a civilian boat.
Man your stations, *please*.
Doug, I'm adding negative ions to our atmosphere. Make you feel a little better first time down.
Mmm! Take a whiff of this. I feel better already.
What is this? Big Brother is watching?
Well, it's better than what you get on the television.

[into the loudspeaker microphone]
Alright, clear the deck! Stand by to dive! On the double!
Well, how do you do, Captain Bligh?
Yeah, he's done some very impressive research in marine biology. M.E. Hanford from England. Well I'm sure you've read for some of his published material in the last couple of years.
*Her* material.
What?
The "M.E." stands for "Margaret Elizabeth." Very attractive, too. As a matter of fact, she just finished doing some research for me.
Well, shall we make it Johnson?
Why, because Hanford's a woman? Half the doctors in Russia are women. Not a bad example for us to follow.
He's got a point.
You wanna put a woman in that submarine for three or four months?
She's also a scientist, and so are we.
Brinkman says you met her in the science building. Under a desk.
Her?
That was M.E. Hanford? Well what d'you say now, boss?
No, more than ever, no.
I'm on this ride for Dr. Hamaru, not for him.
You can at least listen to him, can't you?
Anything that he's in on, I'm on the outside of.
The guinea pigs. What about the guinea pigs?
Guinea pigs? Women and men first. We'll need every cubic inch of air we've got.
[Maggie stares at Hank]
There's a spare mattress down in the lab.
Maggie, you know, according to maritime law, Doug could perform a marriage.
Oh, Orin. Can you imagine spending a honeymoon on a submarine with four other men?
Yes, well I have to admit it's far from ideal.
But thanks anyway.
I couldn't care less, doctor, let 'em all go.
You don't mean that.
Dr. Hamaru, Gus Boren, Dimitri, my crazy, Russian, chess-playing friend...
